drugObject.Name: Adenosine
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Symptomatic (poor perfusion) narrow complex tachycardia w/ pulse

drugObject.Name: Amiodorone
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Ventricular Arrhythmias or Wide Complex Tachycardia with or without a pulse
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: 150 mg IV or IO. Wide Complex is 150mg drip over 10 minutes
Ped Dose: 5 mg/kg IV or IO, up to 3 doses every 5 minutes

drugObject.Name: Atropine Sulfate
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Asystole/Agonal/PEA, Bradycardia and Organophosphate poisoning
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: 0.5-1 mg IV as needed (max 3 mg)
Ped Dose: 0.02 mg/kg (min 0.1 mg - max 1 mg)

drugObject.Name: Calcium Gluconate
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Calcium Channel Overdose, Beta Blocker Overdose, Hydrofluoric Acid Exposure, Hyperkalemia
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: 1 g IV or IO
Ped Dose: 20 mg/kg IV or IO

drugObject.Name: Dextrose 50%
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Cardiac Arrest or altered mentation with glucose level < 50 or Newly Born with heart rate < 60
drugObject.Adult: Ped Dose: ≤ 20 kg- mix dextrose 10%Adm. 0.5 gm/kg (5 ml/kg) IV /// ˃ 20 kg– mix dextrose 25%Adm. 0.5 gm/kg (2 ml/kg) IV

drugObject.Name: Diphenhydramine
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Hives/Rash or Adult dystonic reaction
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: 50 mg IV or IM
Ped Dose: 1 mg/kg IV or IM

drugObject.Name: Epinephrine
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Allergic Reaction/Anaphylaxis, Reactive Airway Disease, PEDI Bradycardia, Cardiac Resuscitation
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: Cardiac Arrest:(1:10,000) 1 mg IV or IO, q 3-5 minutes // Allergic Reaction: 0.3 mg 1:1000 IM
Ped Dose: (1:10,000) 0.01 mg/kg IV or IO, q 3-5 minutes // Allergic Reaction: Epinephrine 0.01 mg/kg 1:1000 IM (max single dose 0.3 mg)

drugObject.Name: Glucagon
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Hypoglycemia < 60 if unable to obtain IV access, Beta blocker OD

drugObject.Name: Lidocaine
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Pain relief for IO infusion, cardiac arrest and post resuscitation care
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: Dose (1) is 1 to 1.5mg/kg IV or IO // Dose (2) is 0.5 to 0.75mg/kg
Ped Dose: Lidocaine 1 mg/kg IV or IO Repeat two additional does every 5 minutes

drugObject.Name: Magnesium Sulfate
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Obstetrical Emergencies/ Seizures (adult only), Reactive Airway Disease, Toxic Exposure (Hydrofluoric Acid), Pulseless Arrest, Tachycardia w/ pulse (adults only)
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: Persistent VF/pulseless VT - Magnesium Sulfate 2 g IV (draw up 2 g in syringe, dilute in 10 mL of NS. Deliver over 1-2 minutes)Persistent VF/pulseless VT Magnesium Sulfate 2 g IV (draw up 2 g in syringe, dilute in 10 mL of NS. Deliver over 1-2 minutes) // Magnesium drip: Magnesium Sulfate 2 gm into 100 mL NS= Magnesium 20 mg/mL
Ped Dose: Torsades: Magnesium Sulfate 50% 50 mg/kg IV Delivered over 20 min

drugObject.Name: Solu-Medrol
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Allergic Reaction/Anaphylaxis, Reactive Airway Disease
drugObject.Adult: Adult Dose: Solu-Medrol 125 mg slow IV or IM
Ped Dose: Solu-Medrol 2 mg/kg slow IV or IM

drugObject.Name: Midazolam(Versed)
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Actively seizing or in status epilepticus
drugObject.Adult: Ped Dose: 0.15 mg/kg IV/IO/IM/IN, up to 2.5mg, max of 5mg

drugObject.Name: Naloxone(Narcan)
drugObject.Adult: IV or IO 0.1 mg/kg - Max Dose 2 mg
Ped Dose: IV or IO 0.1 mg/kg - Max Dose 2 mg

drugObject.Name: Nitroglycerin
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Symptomatic (poor perfusion) narrow complex tachycardia w/ pulse

drugObject.Name: Ondansetron(Zofran)
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Symptomatic (poor perfusion) narrow complex tachycardia w/ pulse

drugObject.Name: Oral Glucose
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Symptomatic (poor perfusion) narrow complex tachycardia w/ pulse

drugObject.Name: Sodium Bicarbonate
drugObject.Indication: Indication: Overdose, Hyperkalemic Arrest, Neonatal Resuscitation (OLMC), Burns, Crush Injuries
